text.p: These are the main stories in the Angolan press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Angolan President Jose Eduardo do Santos held brief talks with visiting Namibia's Prime Minister Hage Geingob who handed over a message from Namibian President Sam Nujoma. Geingob departs on Wednesday.
- Commercial relations between Angola and China had increased in 1996, the head of Chamber of Commerce for China-Angola, Adriano Santos Junior said without giving figures.

- Angolan Prime Minister Franca Van Dunem told the national assembly that the government had enough money to meet obligations in an economic plan to better the lives of Angolans. He did not say how much money had been made available for the project.
